 <li class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom:0cm;text-align:justify;line-height:

     &quot;Times New Roman&quot;;mso-font-kerning:0pt;mso-ligatures:none;mso-fareast-language:
     EN-GB">The application has failed to demonstrate that the development
     would not unduly impact on protected species or habitats on the site or
     enhance the biodiversity value of the site, to the potential detriment of
     ecology and biodiversity in the locality, contrary to policy G6 of The
     London Plan (2021) and policies DM21 and DM 22 of the Harrow Development
     Management Policies Local Plan (2013).&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></li>
</ol>

<ol style="margin-top:0cm" start="3" type="1">
 <li class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom:0cm;text-align:justify;line-height:
     normal;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo1;tab-stops:list 36.0pt"><span style="font-size:12.0pt;font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;mso-fareast-font-family:
     &quot;Times New Roman&quot;;mso-font-kerning:0pt;mso-ligatures:none;mso-fareast-language:
     EN-GB">The proposed two/three storey side to rear extension by reason of
     its excessive combined width, scale, footprint and excessive bulk and
     massing, in conjunction with the rear elementâ€™s unacceptable additional
     storey/roof design, would give rise to &nbsp;disproportionate additions to the
     property which would fail to respect the proportions and character of the
     original building, would unbalance the adjoining semi-detached unit and would
     appear unduly prominent, incongruous and dominant when viewed along the
     street scene.&nbsp; The proposed development would therefore be contrary
     to the high quality design aspirations of the National Planning Policy
     Framework (2023), Policies D3.D(1) and D3.D(11) of The London Plan (2021),
     Policy CS1.B of the Harrow Core Strategy (2012), Policy DM1 of the Harrow
     Development Management Plan Local Policies (2013) and the Adopted
     Supplementary Planning Document: Residential Design Guide (2010).<o:p></o:p></span></li>
</ol>

<ol start="1" type="1">
 <li class="MsoNormal" style="line-height: normal;"><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">The proposed development would result in disproportionate
     additions over and above the size of the original dwellinghouse and would
     therefore constitute inappropriate development in the Green Belt, to the
     detriment of the character, appearance and openness of the Green Belt</span><span style="font-size:12.0pt;font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;mso-fareast-font-family:
     &quot;Times New Roman&quot;;color:windowtext;mso-font-kerning:0pt;mso-ligatures:
     none"> </span><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">and no very special
     circumstances have been demonstrated by the applicant whereby the harm by
     reason of inappropriateness is outweighed by other material considerations.
     The proposal is therefore contrary to the National Planning Policy
     Framework (2023), Policy G2 of The London Plan (2021), Core Policy CS1.F
     of the Harrow Core Strategy (2012) and Policy DM16 of the Harrow
     Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013).&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></li>
</ol>

<p><span style="line-height: 115%;">The proposed rear dormer and roof extension, by
reason of its excessive size and bulk, would result in an overly dominant form
of development that would be unduly obtrusive and incongruous and would detract
from the appearance of the subject property and adjoining semi-detached unit,
to the detriment of the character and appearance of the subject property and
the surrounding area, contrary to the high quality design aspirations of the
National Planning Policy Framework (2023), Policy D3.D.1 and D.11 of The London
Plan (2021), Policy CS1.B of the Harrow Core Strategy (2012), Policy DM1 of the
Development Management Plan Local Policies (2013) and the adopted Supplementary
Planning Document: Residential Design Guide (2010).</span><br></p>
description: Alterations and extension to roof to form end gable; side to rear wrap-a-round dormer; two rooflights in front roofslope; window in end gable; single and two storey side to rear extension; single storey rear extension; external alterations (demolition of detached garage; side extension; ground and first floor side bay windows)
